tool.name: ectyper
tool.description: ectyper is a standalone serotyping module for Escherichia coli. It supports fasta and fastq file formats.
tool.command:
#set $genomes = '' #if hasattr($input, '__iter__') #for $i in $input ln -s "${i}" "${i.element_identifier}" && #if len($genomes) > 0 #set $genomes = $genomes + ',' + str($i.element_identifier) #else #set $genomes = str($i.element_identifier) #end if #end for #else ln -s "${input}" "${input.element_identifier}" && #set $genomes = $input.element_identifier #end if
#if $mash_input ln -s "${mash_input}" mash_sketch.msh && #end if
#if $db_input ln -s "${db_input}" custom_db.json && #end if
ectyper --cores \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} --input "${genomes}" -opid '$adv_param.opid' -opcov '$adv_param.opcov' -hpid '$adv_param.hpid' -hpcov '$adv_param.hpcov' #if $adv_param.verifyEcoli --verify #end if #if $mash_input --refseq mash_sketch.msh #end if #if $db_input --dbpath custom_db.json #end if --output '.'

tool.help:
**Syntax**
This tool identifies the serotype of both assembled or assembly-free Escherichia coli genome samples based on a set of the key O and H antigen determinant genes including *wzm/wzt* or *wzx/wzy* and *fliC/flkA/flmA*. Unique to the tool, species identification module allows for non-E.coli genomes identification including other Escherichia genus species. This version improves antigen call rates on difficult samples by use of an adaptive threshold. This is especially useful when antigen genes are truncated or poorly covered by raw reads. For more information on QC module and running parameter details please visit https://github.com/phac-nml/ecoli_serotyping.
-----
**Input:**
Accepts a variety of inputs including both single and/or multiple FASTQ and/or FASTA file(s). Inputs might contain pure raw reads, but for more accurate results, draft assemblies are recommended.
The default MASH RefSeq genome sketch (https://gembox.cbcb.umd.edu/mash/refseq.genomes.k21s1000.msh) contaning approximalely 91K genomes is included and automatically updated every 6 months.
**Output:**
Tab-delimited report listing identified O and H antigens together with corresponding highest scoring alleles and normalized BLAST score defined as (%identity x query coverage length) / 10000. If *verifyEcoli* option is enabled, report will contain Quality Control information on results for reporting purposes. PASS (REPORTABLE) flag means that sample O and H antigens quality is sufficient to unambigiously resolve them from all other antigens.
-----
**Parameters (Optional):** - **Enable E. coli species verification:** Turn ON/OFF for more rigorous species verification - **Include BLAST allele alignment results tab-delim file in the outputs?** Turn ON/OFF to get reference allele sequences and detailed BLAST output - **Include log file in the run outputs?:** Turn ON/OFF optional logs of the ectyper run for a more detailed results assessment and troubleshooting
